Home.title: Saleh Alqahtani - Full-Stack Developer & Cybersecurity Researcher
Home.intro: I build MVPs, educational apps, rich analytics dashboard and cybersecurity tools that solve real-world problems.

About.title: About Me
About.bio: I'm a full-stack developer and current university instructor at SEU University. I teach programming and information systems courses, including Java, PHP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and backend technologies. I've also led the design and launch of a startup platform that connected service providers with customers. Although the project eventually closed due to funding constraints, it taught me valuable lessons in team leadership, UI/UX design, and product development.
About.currentFocus: My PhD research focuses on detecting phishing and social engineering attacks using machine learning on multilingual datasets. I've developed a system that not only flags suspicious messages, but also explains the risks and educates users using AI-powered feedback.

Projects.name: Phishing Detection Platform
Projects.description: A research-driven web app using machine learning to detect phishing messages in Arabic and English. Includes tailored user education and explanations.

Projects.name: Maze Puzzle Game
Projects.description: A browser-based maze game designed to teach logic and spatial reasoning to students.

Projects.name: Learn and Play Math
Projects.description:
A fun educational platform where kids practice math, spelling, vocabulary, and geometry through interactive games and quizzes.

- Adaptive difficulty keeps kids challenged
- Positive feedback and badges encourage learning
- Modular games for easy expansion

Programming Languages Used: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Python

Projects.name: Phishing Backend API
Projects.description: Node.js backend with PostgreSQL for managing user authentication and report submission for a service app.

Research.title: PhD Research Overview
Research.description: My doctoral research focuses on combating phishing attacks using a human-centered AI model. The model is trained on large Arabic and English corpora and identifies not only whether a message is phishing but also explains why â€” offering real-time educational tips to users. The goal is to shift from binary detection to a learning-focused cybersecurity tool.
